p: Mitochondria, an important source of ROS in most cells [ 8] and their integrity is therefore of utmost importance. During oxidative phosphorylation, ATP synthase uses mitochondrial membrane potential (MMP) to produce ATP [ 9]. MMP provides the driving force for the production of cellular energy in the mitochondria, making ATP a compound buffering MMP. In hypoxic conditions, oxidative phosphorylation is halted, ATP generation is arrested and this leads to mitochondrial dysfunction [ 10].
